Update: The Grand Forks, North Dakota NWS office has confirmed that an EF5 tornado touched down on June 20, 2025.

This means that a modern record streak without an EF5 tornado ended after 4,413 days.

Even more miraculously? This occurred in the midst of a derecho, which is very unexpected.

The first EF-5 in 12 years officially goes to Enderlin, ND. NWS Grand Forks made the announcement earlier this morning (October 6th, 2025) This tornado occurred on June 20th, 2025. Huge props to NWS Grand Forks and other NWS stations for deeply assessing these events. #ef5 #wxbluesky #tornado

This tornado resulted in 3 fatalities and tracked more than 12 miles, reaching over 1 mile wide at times during its 19-minute rampage.

The last tornado to be assigned this rating was the devastating EF-5 tornado that struck Moore, Oklahoma, on May 20th, 2013.

BREAKING: For the first time in more than 12 years, the National Weather Service has upgraded a Tornado Damage survey to the maximum rating; EF-5!

This rating has been given to the June 20th, 2025, Enderlin, ND, tornado, which is now estimated to have packed maximum wind speeds of over 210 MPH!
